author: Dom's Sketch Cast

text: That's true, those tracks are great. But I suppose I'm talking about this particular style of calm. I mean, Earthbound, despite all it's dealings with Aliens and time travel and stuff, still had this feel that it was still taking place in our world, which lead to some pretty awesome jazz-like tracks and overall kept everything sounding kinda modern. You weren't exploring some alien world or anything like that. You were just walking from town to town, haha. Plus, Chiptunes=Yes. For me, anyway.
author: deathkey4

text: Hmm, not sure why so many people say there's no more memorable music in games anymore. I played Assassin's Creed Revelations and it had some amazing pieces in it, big fan of Jesper Kyd (Can't say for ME3 though, ME2 had ok music). I think Extra Credit did a good explaining that since melody was the main focus in older games, it was easier too remember and be hummed. Too me, harmony and atmosphere is just as important as good melody but melody sticks in your head easier. Interesting topic.
author: SkepticalFox

text: Mah Nigga!
author: AznWallRunner

text: I could keep the argument going on here going forever, games are very repetitve outside of indie developers.  There are a lot of good things to come out of this generation.  One bad thing is the severe lack of good game music recently.  Great example played and enjoted Mass Effect 3, not one song in the game was even partially memorable.
author: Matt 6418

text: This whole game had a frakking awesome soundtrack!
author: BygPhattyPlus

text:
This is actually why I don't like these ultra realistic graphics. Afterall, we aren't incapable of imagination we use it with books, comics, online fiction etc. And even in older games in still turns on.
Now with the graphics being such high quality, no one bothers to use their imagination because it's right there on the screen for you.
Case in point give most kids these days a visual novel or text based game and they'll almost instantly deem in bad or not interested.
author: Arc13

text: .edisnooM ot emocleW
author: Honatuto

text: I had a love/hate relationship with this part of the game.  You had that irritating monkey maze and the fetch quest for Trout Yogurt.  You also had awesome experiences seeing the Runaway Five and Venus, Moonside's trippy atmosphere, and ROB's cameo in the Monotoli Building.  My biggest regret is not getting the game earlier as I was 19 in 2009 when I first played it on my SNES with a $70 price tag for the cartridge alone.

text: This song......my god. You can't find stuff this good anymore. Too many overly dramatic orchestral soundtracks. I miss you, Super Nintendo. I really do.
